c74object.name: sdt.rolling~
c74object.digest: Solids interaction: Impact model controller for rolling sound.
c74object.description:
Compound model that simulates a ball rolling on a surface.
sdt.rolling~ acts as control layer for the compound impact model formed by sdt.inertial ↔ sdt.impact~ ↔ sdt.modal.
Takes four control parameters, the depth and the granularity of the surface, the mass and the velocity of the rolling object.
sdt.rolling~ is fed by an audio signal, representing the profile surface. The output is an audio signal representing the force applied to the resonator, i.e. the bounces on the surface.

outlet.digest: Audio signal: Force applied to the first resonator (sdt.inertial).

method.name: signal
method.digest: Input signal representing the morphology of the surface.

attribute.name: depth
attribute.digest: Depth of the surface irregularities, affects the amplitude of the micro-impacts.

attribute.name: grain
attribute.digest: Surface granularity, affects the density of the micro-impacts.

attribute.name: mass
attribute.digest: Mass of the rolling object (shared with the mass of the first resonator, sdt.inertial).

entry.name: signal
entry.description: Inlet 0: Surface profile. The profile of the surface is obtained as a signal input, and it can be either recorded as an audio file or generated in real time. Usually, bandpass filtered noise or fractal noise are two good surface profile generators.

entry.name: signal
entry.description: Outlet 0: Normal force acting on the rolling object, meant to be applied to an inertial mass impacting with another resonator. In addition to the gravity force, when an impact occurs the ball experiences an upward lift, which is assumed to be proportional to the depth of the irregularity and to the kinetic energy of the rolling object.
